reviews.productTitle: Kasa Smart 3 Way Dimmer Switch KIT, Dimmable Light Switch Compatible with Alexa, Google Assistant and SmartThings, Neutral Wire Needed, 2.4GHz, ETL Certified, No Hub Required, White (KS230 KIT v2)
reviews.text: I followed the product's instructions to the letter with installation. The product itself tells you if you did the wiring correctly and the switch light confirmed I had it wired it correctly. Then, in order for the switch to work, you have to pair it on your phone using their app. I downloaded the app, followed all instructions, and it wouldn't pair. I tried several times with my Android phone, no luck, then I downloaded the app on my wife's iphone. Still the app would not pair with either phone. Then, as advised I went to the website to troubleshoot, but there is no troubleshooting on the website. Only descriptions of why the product is so wonderful. The problem is there is no option to skip smart installation which I didn't need. So if it doesn't pair with their OWN APPLICATION, the product doesn't work at all. After wasting more than an hour, I had to undo all of the wiring and I repackaged and returned the product. As it says in the title, it doesn't work with either Android or iphone.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 2, 2025
reviews.title: Simply Put, They Don't Work

reviews.productTitle: Kasa Smart 3 Way Dimmer Switch KIT, Dimmable Light Switch Compatible with Alexa, Google Assistant and SmartThings, Neutral Wire Needed, 2.4GHz, ETL Certified, No Hub Required, White (KS230 KIT v2)
reviews.text: These are terrible switches. I attempted to update the WiFi settings for a new network, but most of the kasa switches won't connect to the new network. It's not a user issue, I have these throughout my house and set them up originally with issue. But changing the network breaks them. Either will never connect or connect for a short period only. And now I have 2, that I never tried to switch the network on suddenly lose the WiFi connection and won't reconnect. I've tried resetting and every work around, but they never get connected to my home network. I've installed dozens of these and ultimately they're a poorly designed product if you can't change network settings or if they can't stay connected. Don't recommend KASA at all now.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 30, 2025
reviews.title: Network issues galore! Beware

reviews.text: Just make sure you do what other reviewers warn, and be sure yo do have that neutral wire installed. And hope the guy who did the prior wiring did it right. Because replacing three way dumb switches with a smart one is a lot easier if the person who put the dumb switch in wasn't like the switch. And I have had good success with TP Link switches. They work well and not had a dud yet. Thought I did once, but turned out to be the wiring from the guy before me.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2025
reviews.title: Good Deal. Reliable. Hopefully the old wiring was done correctly so it'll be an easy job.

reviews.productTitle: Kasa Smart 3 Way Dimmer Switch KIT, Dimmable Light Switch Compatible with Alexa, Google Assistant and SmartThings, Neutral Wire Needed, 2.4GHz, ETL Certified, No Hub Required, White (KS230 KIT v2)
reviews.text: We've used a variety of 'smart devices' throughout our house including smart bulbs. By far, the most reliable method of controlling lights are with these Kasa switches. They're easy to set up, easy to manage, work with Google or Alexa voice commands, operate nicely when using them manually, and are easy to install as long as you have a neutral wire which they require. Our house is older and needed to have neutral wires run to the switches which required we have an electrician assist. Despite the additional cost, it was well worth it. We will have more of these installed shortly so that we can set schedules for when lights should come on when we're out of the house or on vacation, easily dim lights to any desired brightness, and control everything from our phone or tablet from thousands of miles away.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 2, 2025
reviews.title: These are the way to go for smart lighting control

reviews.productTitle: Kasa Smart 3 Way Dimmer Switch KIT, Dimmable Light Switch Compatible with Alexa, Google Assistant and SmartThings, Neutral Wire Needed, 2.4GHz, ETL Certified, No Hub Required, White (KS230 KIT v2)
reviews.text: Bought Kasa smart switches for every light switch in my home, including several of these 3-way dimmer kits. I hired an electrician to install everything and the first 2 sets of the 3 way switches I had him install didn’t work. I had purchased them more than 30 days beforehand so they were unable to to returned. So I bought two more and hired the electricians for a return visit, and those two kits didn’t work. My home is a new build no there were no wiring issues causing any of these problems and to verify, I had the electrician uninstall one of the Kasa Smart 3 way sets that worked and had them install it on the switches where the repurchased sets were not working. The set worked so we knew the wiring wasn’t at fault. So now I’m needing to try a 3rd time as I don’t want to need multiple apps to control my home’s smart switches! So frustrating and expensive to have to keep hiring electricians because a products is faulty!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 2, 2025
reviews.title: Faulty products

reviews.productTitle: Kasa Smart 3 Way Dimmer Switch KIT, Dimmable Light Switch Compatible with Alexa, Google Assistant and SmartThings, Neutral Wire Needed, 2.4GHz, ETL Certified, No Hub Required, White (KS230 KIT v2)
reviews.text: Works perfectly! Wonderful product. I filed around with the Amazon Basic 3 way switch for 2 days. Got the smart switch to work after having to require the regular 3 way to bring power to the smart switch. Then the regular 3 way switch worked, but had to shut it off twice. I gave up. Ordered this Kasa and it came first thing the next morning. Installed both switches in 10 minutes, it automatically connected to Alexa because I already have a Kasa camera connected to Alexa. Renamed it in Alexa and bingo, perfect functionality! Connected switch 1 (main) to the switch that had the line in direct to breaker box. Connected switch 2 to the switch that has the load line going to the light.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 20, 2025
reviews.title: Perfect!

reviews.text: Two Kasa switches have failed when controlling the same ceiling lights. I sought advice from TP Link techical support. I did not receive any technical support at all. Instread, I was required to wait on hold on a customer support line for a very long time and then respond to a series of confusing and poorly worded emails. I was not seeking a replacement although I do need one. Since this is the second Kasa device that has failed for these lights, I wanted some technical advice about why this might be happening. I have spent some considerable time on the phone and responding to emails but I have been unable to obtain any technical advice about what might be going on here. Very frustrating and time-wasting. I realize that I am just one customer out of millions and so have no significance to Kasa, But it is not nice to be treated in this way.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 10, 2025
reviews.title: Poor cusomter service

reviews.productTitle: Kasa Smart 3 Way Dimmer Switch KIT, Dimmable Light Switch Compatible with Alexa, Google Assistant and SmartThings, Neutral Wire Needed, 2.4GHz, ETL Certified, No Hub Required, White (KS230 KIT v2)
reviews.text: Product is great, but in order to operate, BE SURE IN YOUR BOX you not only have a neutral wire (usually white, wired together and bunched in the back of the box) you also need your line (always hot wire, usually single black wire) wire in the same box as the neutral. In my home, I have several three way switches and only one of my boxes had the line wire and neutral. The rest had a neutral with the load (line to the lights) not the line, so had to return.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 8, 2025
reviews.title: Good product BUT BE SURE the three way box with the line (always hot) also has a neutral

reviews.productTitle: Kasa Smart 3 Way Dimmer Switch KIT, Dimmable Light Switch Compatible with Alexa, Google Assistant and SmartThings, Neutral Wire Needed, 2.4GHz, ETL Certified, No Hub Required, White (KS230 KIT v2)
reviews.text: Installed, I am very happy with the switches and their features. If you have installed smart switches before, watch the orientation of the switches. Most require the primary to be on the light side. With the KS230 kit, the opposite is true. The satellite needs to have the load going to the light, and the main has the load going to the main power. Once this is done, installation is simple, and the switches are easy to setup on the KASA app as a single unit. In a bedroom, it is nice having the ring LED's programmable as on or off when the lights are off. When first installed the lights would go off at 40%, but you simply go to Settings and Dimming Calibration, and the entire range is made available for smooth dimming and Alexa can control the entire range. Fade on and fade speed off can be set differently.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 5, 2025
reviews.title: Nice kit for total control of your lights.

Also you can control the dimming from either switch. Finally like being able to use the app to control the switches too.

Didn't make sense to do them as I don't need to use alexa on them like in the kitchen and living room or whatever. We have a 4 year old home that we built so all the wiring is updated if how these hook up. Super easy to do. Just follow instructions. And I'm not an electrician. Don't need one. Common sense says turn off your correct fuses in the box. These are my favorite. I whet with kasa because of the price point and works with alexa. Which there are many that do.

reviews.productTitle: Kasa Smart 3 Way Dimmer Switch KIT, Dimmable Light Switch Compatible with Alexa, Google Assistant and SmartThings, Neutral Wire Needed, 2.4GHz, ETL Certified, No Hub Required, White (KS230 KIT v2)
reviews.text: I'm pretty good with electrical stuff and this took a lot of thought. My line and load were in same box but these switches call for them in separate boxes. They don't have a common like traditional 3-ways. My house had a 14-3 running between boxes. I connected black wire between boxes to load on satellite switch and to the black wire from light(load) in main switch box and tucked it to the back of the box. I used white and red wires between boxes as travelers between switches. (Simple to install once I figured out the workaround.)
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2025
reviews.title: Hard to install if line and load in same junction box

reviews.productTitle: Kasa Smart 3 Way Dimmer Switch KIT, Dimmable Light Switch Compatible with Alexa, Google Assistant and SmartThings, Neutral Wire Needed, 2.4GHz, ETL Certified, No Hub Required, White (KS230 KIT v2)
reviews.text: Installing the Kasa Smart 3-Way Dimmer Switch has been a total game-changer—especially as a parent. If you have kids who constantly leave the lights on, this is a must-have. ✔ Ultimate Convenience – I installed these in the basement, and now I don’t have to trek downstairs every night just to turn off the lights the kids left on. I just tap my phone, and done. ✔ Dimming & Remote Control – Whether I want to set the mood for movie night or just turn the lights off from bed, the app makes it effortless. ✔ Reliable Wi-Fi Connection – No hub required, and they’ve stayed connected without issue. ✔ E-Z setup – It takes just a few minutes per switch and then is typically coupled with an update (switches need firmware updates? What a brave new world..). Then you're good to go. Honestly, once you have one, you’ll want more. These are the kind of smart home upgrades that feel like a superpower. Highly recommend!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2025
reviews.title: The Secret Superpower Every Parent Needs

reviews.productTitle: Kasa Smart 3 Way Dimmer Switch KIT, Dimmable Light Switch Compatible with Alexa, Google Assistant and SmartThings, Neutral Wire Needed, 2.4GHz, ETL Certified, No Hub Required, White (KS230 KIT v2)

And they will not give your money back. I bought a new switch because that was cheaper than hiring an electrician to talk to Kasa. It's a brilliant working model for Kasa. She says sarcastically.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2025
reviews.title: Requires troubleshooting with Kasa when product fails.

reviews.productTitle: Kasa Smart 3 Way Dimmer Switch KIT, Dimmable Light Switch Compatible with Alexa, Google Assistant and SmartThings, Neutral Wire Needed, 2.4GHz, ETL Certified, No Hub Required, White (KS230 KIT v2)
reviews.text: First of all. You will need to have a neutral wire in the switch box to provide some low voltage, constant power to this switch, or it will not work. Do not use the work around either that you can find on YouTube or you could fry your main panel outside. If you are good to go with a neutral wire, these things are AWESOME!!! Works with Alexa and the Kasa App. If you don't have a neutral switch, you'll need to buy a more expensive wi-fi switch that typically cost around $60 each.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2025
reviews.title: Easy Install and Setup

reviews.productTitle: Kasa Smart 3 Way Dimmer Switch KIT, Dimmable Light Switch Compatible with Alexa, Google Assistant and SmartThings, Neutral Wire Needed, 2.4GHz, ETL Certified, No Hub Required, White (KS230 KIT v2)
reviews.text: After hiring 2 separate electricians to install these switches, we determined they were defective. I contacted TP Link and got the run around for another month. They won't refund, and will only send me a replacement set if I pay for shipping. I do not recommend this product. Nothing but lots of wasted time and money.
